title: Russia detains suspect in car bomb attack that killed general
snippets: The FSB say they detained a "Ukrainian special services agent". Kyiv has not commented on the attack.

snippets: Ukraine denies Russian claims it has been forced out of the border region.

The current status is a denial by Ukraine of Russia's claims, indicating ongoing disputes and no clear resolution to the conflict in the mentioned region.

title: Thirteen killed, dozens under rubble as Israel bombs Gaza amid food crisis
snippets: Entire Strip, with a population of two million people, may be on the brink of famine as WFP runs out of supplies.
titles: Thirteen killed, dozens under rubble as Israel bombs Gaza amid food crisis
summary: The Strip, home to two million people, faces a potential famine as the World Food Programme (WFP) reports running out of supplies. This situation puts the area at risk of a major humanitarian crisis if food aid is not promptly restored or increased.

title: Former Inter Milan and Brazil striker Jair da Costa dies at 84
snippets: Brazilian striker Jair da Costa, who helped Inter Milan win its first two European Cups in the 1960s, has died in Osasco, outside Sao Paulo.  The Brazilian Football Confederation announced the death on Saturday without elaborating.  Da Costa was a key forward for the Inter side which won the European Cup in 1963 against Alfredo Di Stefano's Real Madrid, and in 1964 against Eusebio's Benfica.
titles: Former Inter Milan and Brazil striker Jair da Costa dies at 84
summary: Brazilian footballer Jair da Costa, known for his pivotal role in Inter Milan's first two European Cup victories in the 1960s, has passed away in Osasco, near Sao Paulo. His death was confirmed by the Brazilian Football Confederation on Saturday. Da Costa was instrumental in Inter's triumphs over Real Madrid in 1963 and Benfica in 1964, contributing significantly to the team's success during that era.

titles: 2025 NFL draft: Saints use their final pick on 3-4 pass rusher Fadil Diggs
summary: The 2025 NFL draft concluded with the New Orleans Saints selecting Fadil Diggs, a pass rusher known for his proficiency in a 3-4 defensive scheme, with their final pick.

title: 2025 NFL draft: Saints pick UCLA breakout tight end Moliki Matavao
snippets: The Saints closed out the 2025 NFL draft with UCLA tight end Moliki Matavao in Round 7. He broke out last year and led his team in receiving yards.
titles: 2025 NFL draft: Saints pick UCLA breakout tight end Moliki Matavao
summary: The Saints concluded the 2025 NFL draft by selecting UCLA tight end Moliki Matavao in the seventh round. Matavao had a standout year prior, leading his team in receiving yards, indicating his potential value to the Saints' offense.

title: Republicans plan to scrap US audit regulator
snippets: Proposal to fold the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board into the SEC will boost Donald Trump’s deregulatory agenda
titles: Republicans plan to scrap US audit regulator
summary: A proposal has been made to integrate the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) into the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). This move aligns with Donald Trump's broader strategy to reduce regulatory burdens, aiming to streamline oversight and potentially enhance efficiency in public company accounting standards and compliance.

title: DeepMind UK staff seek to unionise and challenge defence deals and Israel links
snippets: Move by employees at Google’s AI arm follows discontent after weapons and surveillance pledge is dropped
titles: DeepMind UK staff seek to unionise and challenge defence deals and Israel links
summary: Employees at Google's AI division have expressed discontent and taken action following the company's decision to drop a pledge against using its technology for weapons and surveillance purposes. The move by these employees highlights concerns over the ethical implications of AI applications in military and surveillance contexts.

title: Less intensive farming works best for agricultural soil
snippets: The less intensively you manage the soil, the better the soil can function. Such as not plowing as often or using more grass-clover mixtures as cover crops. Surprisingly, it applies to both conventional and organic farming.
titles: Less intensive farming works best for agricultural soil
summary: Studies suggest that reducing the intensity of soil management, including practices like less frequent plowing and the use of grass-clover mixtures as cover crops, enhances soil functionality. This improvement is observed in both conventional and organic farming methods, indicating that less intensive soil management can benefit agricultural practices across the board by potentially increasing soil health and productivity.
